result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey J. Heitzmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey J. Heitzmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey J. Heitzmann was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell August 23, 2018 - amend to misdemeanor.

Defendant to report to Probation today June 29, 2018.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Arne Richard Skatrud, DF: Casey J. Heitzmann appeared.  Court called.  Set for STC.  State is making a Motion to Revoke the DJOC.  Attorney Skatrud makes a statement.  Court grants the Motion to Reboke and enters the adjudication of Guilt.  Attorneys make arguement.  Crt. orders:

S/W 1 year probation with conditions to run concurrent with any other probation 
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through probation
- DE to report to probation today 06/29/2018
- 20 days to appeal
Status conference on June 29, 2018 at 10:00 am.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Arne Richard Skatrud DF: Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann appeared. Case called at 9:52. Includes 14CF212, 17TR2272, 17TR2273, 17CT101, 17CM795, 17CM764, 17CM7021, 17CM722. 17CM536, 18CM36, 18CM92. Scheduled for plea and sentencing. Atty's agree they are headed towards trial on the 17th. 17CT101 is the driving case. If case goes to plea on the day of the trial costs would be assessed against DE.  Motions in limine, witness lists, verdict forms and jury instructions due by 05-11-2018. Atty. Skatrud would like to be heard on bond. DE to send or fax a letter regarding travel for work.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Casey J. Heitzmann appeared.  Court called at 10:28 a.m.  State files a DJOC for 14CF212 Ct. 1.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO Contest to Ct 1 in 14CF212.   Court uses testimony from the Motion Hearing.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the adjudication upon full performance of the DJOC.    DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 14CF518.  Court reviews the drafted probable cause to find factual basis.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 14CF518.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct 3 & Ct. 4 in 14CF212 & Ct. 1 in 14CF518.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:


Ct. 2 14CF518 
- W/S 1 year probation to run concurrent with any other current probation 
 - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Court costs of $243.00
- DE to report to probation today 09/11/15
- Bail to remain in effect until DE has signed up for probation
- 20 days to appeal


Court reviews the DJOC with the DE.
Court approves and signs the 24 month DJOC for Ct. 1 in 14CF212.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-11-2015 10:15 am
